description: A weak, cheap replica of ancient Roman laminar armor, made of overlapping metal strips connected to internal leather straps.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A cheap replica of a customized chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A cheap aluminum breastplate, and a vital part of plate armor.  Even as full armor went into decline, cuirasses remained in use among cavalry in Europe.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A cheap pair of aluminum chainmail legs.  Their straps keep everything in place, and the lack of toes and heels allows them to work perfectly well with footwear.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

name.str: pair of XL steel leg guards
name.str_pl: pairs of XL steel leg guards

description: A cheap mockery of medieval leg protection.  Cuisses, poleyns, and greaves, with leather straps to secure each piece and connect it as part of a set.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A suit of aluminum plate armor, probably used for LARPing  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
An extremely heavy suit of aluminum armor, probably used in cosplay. Cosplate, if you will.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
